thread.title: Ten Instagrammers who will inspire you to travel to the UK
thread.title_full: Ten Instagrammers who will inspire you to travel to the UK

author: READER REPORT: George Turner
title: Ten Instagrammers who will inspire you to travel to the UK
text:
Ten Instagrammers who will inspire you to travel to the UK READER REPORT: GEORGE TURNER Last updated 15:45, October 12 2015 Chris Buxton 
Chris Buxton is a Wales / UK based photographer and Instagrammer. 
The UK is often overlooked in terms of beauty. . 
But scratch beneath the surface of the well-known tourist traps and you'll find everything from pristine beaches through to huge (well, in our definition of the word) mountains, undiscovered splendour, glacially carved lakes and landscapes straight from the pages of an Enid Blyton novel. 
And what better way to explore the 'real' United Kingdon, than by looking through the eyes of the people who know it best? A photo posted by Johnny (@_jfoy_) on Sep 24, 2015 at 10:17pm PDT 
Peaks, ruined castles and gorgeous Lochs. Johnny captures the rugged and raw side of Scotland that makes it so beautiful. A photo posted by Tim Holt ðŸ‡¬ðŸ‡§ (@timholt) on Jul 17, 2015 at 3:40am PDT 
Scotland has the Highlands, Northern Ireland has Loughs, Wales has Snowdonia. England? The Lake District and boy, is it stunning. A photo posted by George Turner (@georgetheexplorer) on Sep 21, 2015 at 1:11pm PDT 
Sunrise on the South Coast through to the rolling hills of the West Country, George - who was recently in NZ for a year - is now on a road trip across the UK showing the world the sheer diversity of the landscapes. A photo posted by Chris Buxton (@buxtonc) on Mar 29, 2015 at 11:12am PDT 
In Europe, you'd usually associate glacially carved lakes and big mountains with The Alps but no, Chris is on a mission to prove that Wales equals that beauty! A photo posted by @joanna on Sep 17, 2015 at 5:34am PDT 
White cliffs and turquoise waterâ€¦ is this the Caribbean? Nope, this is Dorset's beautiful World Heritage coastline, chock-a-bloc full of hidden coves, golden beaches and huge cliffs. A photo posted by Russell Davies (@russell_davies) on Sep 18, 2015 at 12:01pm PDT 
Russell is a self-proclaimed "Munro bagger", on a mission to climb all of Scotland's hills over 914m. Collecting an amazing series of photos along the way, you'll see why. A photo posted by Will Bendall (@willbendall) on Jun 25, 2015 at 8:00am PDT 
Misty lakes, enchanted woods and rolling hills: Will's photos capture the fairytale-esque Welsh landscape. Not convinced? Just take a look at his page! A photo posted by adam (@adampartridge) on Aug 20, 2015 at 3:15am PDT 
Huge sea stacks, massive cliffs and postcard-perfect Dorset villages. Adam's photos give a unique insight into the way of life in Southern England and spoiler alert, it's straight out of an Enid Blyton novel. A photo posted by Steve Oates (@wilde_oates) on Oct 5, 2015 at 11:47pm PDT 
From the city-scape of Edinburgh through to the huge - well, by UK terms - Highlands, Steve's shots give a unique insight into the pure beauty of the Scottish landscape. A photo posted by Carolyn Campbell (@ccgar1981) on Sep 13, 2015 at 4:06am PDT 
Pristine coastline through to the tall ships of Belfast. Find all this and then some through Carolyn's shots, with a few amazing Lough views thrown in for good measure! - Stuff
